summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Jeffrey Epstein on charges of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. It details allegations of a multi-year scheme from 2002-2005 where Epstein sexually exploited dozens of underage girls in New York and Florida, using a network of victims and associates to recruit others.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor bringing federal charges against Epstein.
Sweeney, as FBI Assistant Director, is leading the federal investigation into Epstein's alleged crimes.
O'Neill, as NYPD Commissioner, is supporting the investigation and prosecution of Epstein.
The indictment alleges Epstein worked with employees and associates to contact victims and schedule sexual encounters.
Epstein is accused of sexually exploiting dozens of underage girls, paying them cash, and having some recruit others.
The indictment alleges Epstein paid certain victims to recruit additional underage girls for him to abuse.

locations: New York, New York (specifically his mansion/residence on the Upper East Side of Manhattan)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with one count of sex trafficking of minors (max 40 years) and one count of conspiracy to engage in sex trafficking of minors (max 5 years).
The alleged criminal scheme operated from at least 2002 through 2005, exploiting dozens of underage girls, some as young as 14.
Epstein allegedly used a network where he paid victims to recruit other underage girls, creating a steady supply of new victims.
The abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in New York City (Upper East Side) and Palm Beach, Florida, under the guise of providing 'massages.'
The press release includes a public call for other potential victims to contact the FBI at 1-800-CALL-FBI.
